question.text:
For a somatic cell with 2n = 4. Which of the following is true?
(Note:- G1 - growth phase 1, G2 - growth phase 2, M- Metaphase, P - Prophase and T - Telophase)

options.text: Number of chromatids in G<sub>2</sub> = 4, Number of chromosome in G<sub>1</sub> = 4
Number of chromatids in G<sub>1</sub> = 8, Number of sister chromatids in T = 8
Number of chromatids in P = 8, Number of chromosomes in G<sub>2</sub> = 4
Number of Chromatids in G<sub>2</sub> = 4, Number of Chromosomes in M = 8

solution.text:
Somatic cells undergo mitotic cell division so, there is no reduction division and chromosome number remain the same. At the beginning of mitosis, there are 4 chromosomes, and each chromosome replicates during S phase and form sister chromatids. So the number of chromosomes is 4, and chromatids are 4 x 2 = 8. Hence, during G1 phase
Chromatids number - 4
Chromosomes number- 4
During S phase
Chromatids number - 8
Chromosome number – 4
During the G2 phase
Chromatids number - 8
Chromosomes number - 4
